intro: Calonyction bona-nox var. normale, commonly known as the nightshade or moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night and close by morning. The plant produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a slightly hairy texture.
